content.description:
A clean and enjoyable but run-out slab up a distinct white-colored water streak. Recommended for those solid at the grade or top-rope from the anchors on

Pizza Pizza

.
content.protection:
One bolt (3/8"), 2 bolt anchor/rap (3/8") shared with

Pizza Pizza

.
content.location:
Left side of the face and left of

Little Caesar

.

climbs.name: Roman Holiday
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Lisa Guindon, November 1995

content.description:
Climbs a crack to unprotected face then up to anchors atop

Pizza Pizza

.
content.protection:
TR from bolts atop

Pizza Pizza
content.location:
Between

Toga Party

and

Little Caesar

.

climbs.name: Pizza Pizza
climbs.fa: Dave Haber, Shery Haber, and Alan Bartlett

content.description: A short, mediocre face climb on gritty rock.

Climb a slab past two reasonably spaced bolts (5.8) before making a runout on easier ground to the anchors.

This is the original route on the face, and the route actually cuts way right to a third bolt well right of Pizza Pizza before ending at the top of the wall. Most seem to ignore this last bolt as it seems poorly located and just finish straight up to the anchors on Pizza Pizza.
content.protection: 3 bolts, optional bolted anchor/rap (shared with Pizza Pizza). The first two bolts have been replaced and are 3/8".
content.location:
This is the bolted route between

Toga Party

and

Pizza Pizza

that leads almost directly to bolted anchors.
